question:
The equation ΔH = ΔU + PΔV is applicable
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. always
B. only for constant pressure processes
C. only for constant temperature processes
D. only for constant volume processes
Answer:

The T2 of an NMR line is 15 ms. Ignoring other sources of linebroadening, calculate its linewidth.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.0471 Hz
B. 21.2 Hz
C. 42.4 Hz
D. 66.7 Hz
Answer:

Which of the following is classified as a conjugate acid-base pair?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl / NaOH
B. H3O+ / H2O
C. O2 / H2O
D. H+ / Cl−
Answer:

The 99Ru chemical shift of [Ru(H2O)6]2+ is 16,050 ppm relative to [Ru(CN)6]2- at 0 ppm. The electronic excitation energies of [Ru(H2O)6]2+, [Ru(CN)6]2- and [Ru(NH3)6]2+ are 18,900, 40,000 and 25,600 cm-1 respectively. Assuming that the chemical shift differences are dominated by paramagnetic currents, determine the chemical shift of [Ru(NH3)6]2+.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 7,530 ppm
B. 8,090 ppm
C. 11,070 ppm
D. 14,840 ppm
Answer:

Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) such as F3CCCl3 are implicated in the decomposition of stratospheric ozone. Which of the following methods would be best suited to measurement of trace amounts (sub-ppb) of CFCs in an air sample?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Gas chromatographic separation of the air sample on a capillary column followed by electron capture detection
B. Gas chromatographic separation of the air sample on a packed column followed by thermal conductivity detection
C. Gas chromatographic separation of the air sample on a capillary column followed by flame ionization detection
D. Conversion of the sample of the chlorinated compounds to chloride ions, followed by titration with Ag+
Answer:

The rotational correlation time of a spherical object of radius r immersed in a liquid with viscosity η is given by the Stokes equation: τc = 4πηr3/3kBT. A small molecule with relative molecular mass Mr = 100 in water at 298 K has τc = 50 ps. Assuming that Mr is proportional to the molecular volume, estimate τc for a small protein with Mr = 8400.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 420 ns
B. 42 ns
C. 4.2 ns
D. 420 ps
Answer:

On the basis of oxidation-reduction potential, which of the following is most likely to occur?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Al(s) + 3 NaNO3(aq) 3 Na(s) + Al(NO3)3(aq)
B. Zn(s) + 2 Ag(NO3)(aq) → 2 Ag(s) + Zn(NO3)2(aq)
C. Pb(s) + Ca(NO3)2(aq) → Ca(s) + Pb(NO3)2(aq)
D. Pb(s) + 2 LiNO3(aq) → 2 Li(s) + Pb(NO3)2(aq)
Answer:

Which of the following is the most common naturally-occurring form in which silicon is found?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Metallic element
B. Sulfide
C. Fluoride
D. Oxide
Answer:

A PO3- radical produces a pair of lines separated by 280 MHz with giso = 2.005. Calculate the expected resonant field positions of both lines in the X-band EPR spectrum (ν = 9.5 GHz).
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Bres for mI = -½ = 325.0 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 335.0 mT
B. Bres for mI = -½ = 123.5 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 124.5 mT.
C. Bres for mI = -½ = 333.5 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 343.5 mT.
D. Bres for mI = -½ = 0.218 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 0.418 mT.
Answer:

A student performs five titrations and obtains a mean result of 0.110 M, with a standard deviation of 0.001 M. If the actual concentration of the titrated solution is 0.100 M, which of the following is true about the titration results?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Accurate but not precise
B. Precise but not accurate
C. Both accurate and precise
D. Neither accurate nor precise
Answer:

What is the strength (B1) of a 13C 90° pulse of duration 1 μs?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.72 mT
B. 5.18 mT
C. 17.0 mT
D. 23.3 mT
Answer:

Of the following compounds, which has the lowest melting point?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl
B. AgCl
C. CaCl2
D. CCl4
Answer:

Which of the following is (are) characteristic of mass spectrometry?
I. Analyte molecules are converted to gaseous ions.
II. The ions are separated according to their mass-to-charge ratio.
III. In addition to compound identification, mass spectra can be utilized to determine precise isotopic masses and isotopic ratios.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. II only
B. I and II only
C. I and III only
D. I, II, and III
Answer:

The magnetic moment (μI) of an unknown nuclide is 2.884 x 10^-27 J T-1. Given the nuclear spin is known to be 1, identify the unknown nuclide.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 14N
B. 2H
C. 19F
D. 6Li
Answer:

Which of the following compounds has a 1H resonance approximately 1.55 kHz away from TMS on a spectrometer with a 12.0 T magnet?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3F
B. CH3Cl
C. CH3Br
D. CH3I
Answer:

When the Heisenberg uncertainty principle is applied to a quantum mechanical particle in the lowest energy level of a one-dimensional box, which of the following is true?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Momentum is known exactly, but no information about position can be known.
B. Position is known exactly, but no information about momentum can be known.
C. No information about either position or momentum can be known.
D. Neither position nor momentum can be known exactly.
Answer:

Which of the following statements is not a reason why tetramethylsilane is used as a 1H chemical shift reference.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Its 1H spectrum is a singlet.
B. Its protons are quite strongly shielded.
C. It dissolves in most organic solvents.
D. Most organic compounds do not contain silicon atoms.
Answer:

Of the following atoms, which has the lowest electron affinity?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. F
B. Si
C. O
D. Ca
Answer:

A single line is seen in the 31P spectrum of a solution of sodium phosphate. The 31P chemical shifts of H2PO4‾ and HPO42– are 3.42 ppm and 5.82 ppm respectively. What is the chemical shift when the pH of the solution equals the pKa of H2PO4‾?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.41 ppm
B. 3.98 ppm
C. 4.33 ppm
D. 4.62 ppm
Answer:

Calculate the relative occupancies of the α and β spin energy levels for a radical species with g = 2.05, at L- and W-band frequencies (take TS = 300 K).
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Nα/Nβ = 0.9800 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9509 at W-band
B. Nα/Nβ = 0.9950 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9609 at W-band
C. Nα/Nβ = 0.9910 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9709 at W-band
D. Nα/Nβ = 0.9850 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9809 at W-band
Answer:

At 25°C, the maximum amount of PbI2 that can be dissolved in 1.00 L of pure water is 1.0 mmol. Assuming complete dissociation, the solubility product, K_sp, for lead iodide at 25°C is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1.0 × 10^−3
B. 1.0 × 10^−6
C. 1.0 × 10^−9
D. 4.0 × 10^−9
Answer:

When the following equation is balanced, which of the following is true?
__ MnO4− + __ I− + __ H+ <-> __ Mn2+ + __ IO3− + __ H2O
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The I− : IO3− ratio is 3:1.
B. The MnO4- : I- ratio is 6:5.
C. The MnO4- : Mn2+ ratio is 3:1.
D. The H+ : I− ratio is 2:1.
Answer:

The Henry’s law constant for CO2 dissolved in water at 25°C is 30.0 atm M^−1. The concentration of dissolved CO2 in a vessel pressurized with 2.0 atm of CO2 is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1.5 M
B. 0.15 M
C. 0.067 M
D. 0.015 M
Answer:

Nitronyl nitroxides are stable radicals in which the unpaired electron is coupled to two equivalent nitrogen nuclei. How many lines will appear in the EPR spectrum of a solution of a rigid nitronyl nitroxide diradical with J << a?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3 lines
B. 9 lines
C. 5 lines
D. 7 lines
Answer:

The solid-state structures of the principal allotropes of elemental boron are made up of which of the following structural units?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. B12 icosahedra
B. B8 cubes
C. B6 octahedra
D. B4 tetrahedra
Answer:

Which of the following procedures tend(s) to minimize the influence of random errors on measured results?
I. Signal averaging
II. Use of internal standards
III. Averaging the results from multiple samples
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. II only
C. III only
D. I and III only
Answer:

A buffer is made from equal concentrations of a weak acid and its conjugate base. Doubling the volume of the buffer solution by adding water has what effect on its pH?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It has little effect.
B. It significantly increases the pH.
C. It significantly decreases the pH.
D. It changes the pH asymptotically to the pKa of the acid.
Answer:

Calculate the Larmor frequency for a proton in a magnetic field of 1 T.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 23.56 GHz
B. 42.58 MHz
C. 74.34 kHz
D. 13.93 MHz
Answer:

The rate, r, of a zero-order chemical reaction A → B can be expressed as which of the following?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. r = k ln[A]
B. r = k [A]^2
C. r = k [A]
D. r = k
Answer:

Which of the following statements about nuclear binding energies is NOT true?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Binding energy per nucleon reaches a maximum for 56Fe.
B. Nuclear binding energies have about the same magnitude as chemical bond energies.
C. Nuclei have slightly less mass than the sum of their component nucleons.
D. The nuclei of heavy elements have more neutrons than protons in order to provide sufficient binding energy to hold the nuclei together.
Answer:

Predict the hyperfine value for the EPR spectrum of fully deuteriated benzene radical anion C6D6•-.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.375 mT
B. 3.75 G
C. 2.35 mT
D. 0.58 G
Answer:

Which of the following types of spectroscopy is a light-scattering technique?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Nuclear magnetic resonance
B. Infrared
C. Raman
D. Ultraviolet-visible
Answer:

Calculate the Q-factor for an X-band EPR cavity with a resonator bandwidth of 1.58 MHz.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Q = 1012
B. Q = 2012
C. Q = 3012
D. Q = 6012
Answer:

In fluorescence spectroscopy, the quantum yield (Φ_f) is best defined as the
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. rate of fluorescence emission
B. number of photons emitted
C. number of photons emitted, divided by the number of photons absorbed
D. number of excitation photons impinging on the sample, divided by the number of photons absorbed
Answer:

The normal modes of a carbon dioxide molecule that are infrared-active include which of the following?
I. Bending
II. Symmetric stretching
III. Asymmetric stretching
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. II only
C. III only
D. I and III only
Answer:

23Na has an NMR frequency of 198.52 MHz in a 750 MHz NMR spectrometer. What is its magnetogyric ratio?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 101.1 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
B. 26.75 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
C. 7.081 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
D. 0.9377 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
Answer:

Cobalt-60 is used in the radiation therapy of cancer and can be produced by bombardment of cobalt-59 with which of the following?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Neutrons
B. Alpha particles
C. Beta particles
D. X-rays
Answer:

Exact solutions of the Schrödinger equation CANNOT be obtained for a
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. simple harmonic oscillator
B. particle in a one-dimensional box
C. rigid rotor
D. helium atom
Answer:

The molecular geometry of thionyl chloride, SOCl2, is best described as
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. trigonal planar
B. T-shaped
C. tetrahedral
D. trigonal pyramidal
Answer:

What is the maximum value of the z-component of the spin angular momentum of 43Ca? [I = 7⁄2]
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.691 x 10^-34 J s
B. 4.185 x 10^-34 J s
C. 5.493 x 10^-34 J s
D. 8.370 x 10^-34 J s
Answer:

Of the following solutions, which will have the highest ionic strength? (Assume complete dissociation.)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.050 M AlCl3
B. 0.100 M NaCl
C. 0.050 M CaCl2
D. 0.100 M HCl
Answer:

Which of the following must be true about a binary liquid mixture that obeys Raoult’s law?
I. The partial pressure of each component at equilibrium is proportional to its mole fraction in the liquid mixture.
II. The volume of the mixture is equal to the sum of the volumes of each component before mixing.
III. Intermolecular interactions in the mixture are identical to intermolecular interactions in the pure components.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. III only
C. I and III only
D. I, II, and III
Answer:

In the vibrational-rotational spectrum of a diatomic molecule, the R-branch of the spectrum is the result of which of the following transitions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ΔJ = 0; Δu = 0
B. ΔJ = 1; Δu = 0
C. ΔJ = 2; Δu = 0
D. ΔJ = 1; Δu = 1
Answer:

Calculate the spin angular momentum of 43Ca. [I = 7⁄2]
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2.166 x 10^-34 J s
B. 3.691 x 10^-34 J s
C. 4.185 x 10^-34 J s
D. 5.493 x 10^-34 J s
Answer:

The X-band (9.5 GHz) EPR spectrum of a matrix isolated Na atom reveals four hyperfine lines with resonant field positions of 3074 G, 3174 G, 3274 G and 3374 G. Calculate the g value of the atom.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. g = 2.002
B. g = 1.950
C. g = 2.250
D. g = 2.005
Answer:

The 1H Larmor frequency of benzene exceeds that of trifluoroacetic acid by 1.656 kHz on a 400 MHz spectrometer. The 1H chemical shift of benzene is 7.16 ppm. What is the chemical shift of trifluoroacetic acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.02 ppm
B. 5.03 ppm
C. 10.56 ppm
D. 11.30 ppm
Answer:

The number of allowed energy levels for the 55Mn nuclide are:
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3
B. 5
C. 8
D. 4
Answer:

Nitronyl nitroxides are stable radicals in which the unpaired electron is coupled to two equivalent nitrogen nuclei. How many lines will appear in the EPR spectrum of a solution of a rigid nitronyl nitroxide diradical with J >> a?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3 lines
B. 9 lines
C. 5 lines
D. 7 lines
Answer:

Calculate the magnetic moment (μI) of a 13C nucleus.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 6.1445 x 10^-27 J T-1
B. 3.1445 x 10^-27 J T-1
C. 9.1445 x 10^-27 J T-1
D. 1.1445 x 10^-28 J T-1
Answer:

The amplitude of a free induction decay drops to 25% of its initial intensity after 1.0 s. Assuming exponential relaxation and Ω = 0, determine the value of T2.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.721 s
B. 0.750 s
C. 1.386 s
D. 1.661 s
Answer:
